greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Continued fraction for L(3, chi3), where L(s, chi3) is the Dirichlet L-function for the non-principal character modulo 3.
comment: Contributed to OEIS on April 15, 2007 -- the 300th anniversary of the birth of Leonhard Euler.
reference: Leonhard Euler, "Introductio in Analysin Infinitorum", First Part, Articles 176 and 292
formula: chi3(k) = Kronecker(-3, k); chi3(k) is 0, 1, -1 when k reduced modulo 3 is 0, 1, 2, respectively; chi3 is A049347 shifted.
Closed form: L(3, chi3) = 4 Pi^3/(81 sqrt(3)).
results.author: _Stuart Clary_, Apr 15 2007
